document_data.name: Cloudberry
document_data.mainbody: '''Cloudberries''' were a species of [[raspberry]] endemic to the [[High Moor]] region.
document_data.Description:
Much like other raspberry species, the fruits of the cloudberry bush grew on long, [[whip]]-like and wiry branches that were known as canes. But unlike the standard raspberry, these fruits had a yellowish hue.

Much like the [[bilberry]] bush, their canes tended to form dense, interwoven thickets that made it challenging to retrieve these berries.
document_data.Usage: Said to be very palatable, cloudberries were a staple in the diet of many animals that inhabited the High Moor plateau, with even [[human]]s and [[goblinkin]] known to forage for them.
